info.title: IronDefense
info.description: IronNet allows clients to interface with the IronDefense backend through a curated set of endpoints. This provides customers with the capability to triage alerts outside of IronVue.

post.description: Allows a client to comment on any given alert, with the option to send to IronDome (if enrolled). The default request rate limit on this endpoint is 10 requests per second.

post.summary: Gets IronDome information related to an Alert
post.description: Allows a client to retrieve community IronDome correlation information for an alert. The default request rate limit on this endpoint is 10 requests per second.

Allows a client to retrieve alert notifications from IronDefense without pulling duplicate messages that have already been ingested. The default request rate limit on this endpoint is 10 requests per second.

Allows a client to retrieve IronDefense alerts in an environment. The response can be filtered based on the alert field parameters and limited to a given number of alerts. The default request rate limit on this endpoint is 10 requests per second.

Allows a client to retrieve dome notifications from IronDefense without pulling duplicate messages that have already been ingested. The default request rate limit on this endpoint is 10 requests per second.
Allows a client to retrieve details for an IronDefense event including the event context. The default request rate limit on this endpoint is 10 requests per second.

Allows a client to retrieve event notifications from IronDefense without pulling duplicate messages that have already been ingested. The default request rate limit on this endpoint is 10 requests per second.

Allows a client to retrieve IronDefense events for a particular IronDefense alert. Event context information is not included in these event objects. The default request rate limit on this endpoint is 10 requests per second.
Allows a client to login and retrieve a valid JSON Web Token (JWT) to use in subsequent calls. The default request rate limit on this endpoint is 10 requests per second.
Allows a client to rate an alert as part of the review/triage process. The default request rate limit on this endpoint is 10 requests per second.

Allows a client to submit a domain and/or IP of observed bad activity for Threat Intelligence Rule, event/alert creation and IronDome correlation. The default request rate limit on this endpoint is one request per 10 minutes. This limit is imposed as the goal of this endpoint is to ingest malicious activity discovered by other security tools within the enterprise network. It is not intended to provide a means to integrate third party threat intelligence feeds or to query IronDome for information about indicators of compromise.
Allows a client to change an alert's status to progress it through the review process. The default request rate limit on this endpoint is 10 requests per second.
Allows a client to send IP lease information from a source of entity information. The default request rate limit on this endpoint is 10 requests per second.

last_event_created.title: The last created date of any associated event on this alert

alertAlertNotification.title: A notification of a lifecycle change related to an alert

alertAlertNotificationAction.description:
- ANA_ALERT_CREATED: alert created
 - ANA_ALERT_UPDATED: alert updated
 - ANA_WORKFLOW_CREATED: alert workflow created (alert being reviewed/rated)
 - ANA_WORKFLOW_UPDATED: alert workflow updated (alert being reviewed/rated)
 - ANA_ALERT_DELETED: alert deleted
 - ANA_NOTE_CREATED: alert note created (alert being commented on)
 - ANA_NOTE_UPDATED: alert note updated (alert being commented on)
 - ANA_ALERT_EVENT_ADDED: a new event has been associated with an alert
alertAlertNotificationAction.title: The action being performed on an alert

direction.title: The direction to sort in - defaults to ascending if not present

alertAlertSortField.title:
- ASF_CREATED: Sort on the alert created time
 - ASF_UPDATED: Sort on the alert updated time
 - ASF_SEVERITY: Sort on the alert severity
 - ASF_FIRST_EVENT_CREATED: Sort on the time the first event of this alert was created
 - ASF_LAST_EVENT_CREATED: Sort on the time the most recent event of this alert was created
 - ASF_FIRST_EVENT_START_TIME: Sort on the activity's start time for the first event of this alert
 - ASF_LAST_EVENT_END_TIME: Sort on the activity's end time for the most recent event of this alert

mismatch_details.title: Details regarding severity mismatches (present if the nofication is DNC_COMMUNITY_SEVERITY_MISMATCHED or DNC_ENTERPRISE_SEVERITY_MISMATCHED)

severity_details.title: Details related to the severity (present if the notification is DNC_COMMUNITY_SEVERITY_CHANGED)

comment_details.title: Details related to a community comment that has been added (present if the notification is DNC_COMMENT_ADDED)

severity_suspicious_details.title: Correlation-related details (present if the correlated alert has an analyst serverity of SUSPICIOUS)

severity_malicious_details.title: Correlation-related details (present if the correlated alert has an analyst serverity of MALICIOUS)

high_cognitive_system_score_details.title: Details related to a high score output from cognitive system

domeDomeNotificationCategory.description:
- DNC_PARTICIPANT_ADDED: A new participant was added
 - DNC_COMMENT_ADDED: A new comment was added
 - DNC_COMMUNITY_SEVERITY_CHANGED: The community severity of an alert has changed
 - DNC_COMMUNITY_SEVERITY_MISMATCHED: There is a mitmatch in the community severity of correlated alerts
 - DNC_ENTERPRISE_SEVERITY_MISMATCHED: There is a mismatch in the enterprise severity of correlated alerts
 - DNC_SEVERITY_SUSPICIOUS: An alert has been marked suspicious
 - DNC_SEVERITY_MALICIOUS: An alert has been marked malicious
 - DNC_JOINED_HIGH_RISK: An alert has been deemed high risk
 - DNC_HIGH_COGNITIVE_SYSTEM_SCORE: An alert has a high cognitive system score

eventEventNotification.title: A notification of a lifecycle change related to an event

eventEventNotificationAction.description:
- ENA_EVENT_CREATED: event created
 - ENA_EVENT_RETRO_WHITELISTED: event was retroactively whitelisted
 - ENA_EVENT_ADDED_TO_ALERT: event was added to an alert
 - ENA_EVENT_DELETED: event deleted
 - ENA_EVENT_ALERT_UNDER_REVIEW: the alert that this event is associated with is under review
 - ENA_EVENT_ALERT_CLOSED: the alert that this event is associated with has been closed
